abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Seeds
            and Agricultural Services Project is to improve agricultural
            productivity of rainfed and irrigated crops. Four components
            comprise the project: 1) promoting information media
            campaigns to encourage private operators to enter the seed
            and fertilizer subsectors, to increase farmers' use of
            quality seeds and fertilizers, and to build the capacity of
            the governmental agency implementing seed and fertilizer
            quality control; 2) seed sourcing and variety testing, and
            restructuring existing seed centers to commercialize and
            privatize their operations; 3) expanding input supply
            marketing channels to address the undersupply of inputs due
            to existing private sector oligopolies; and 4) establishing
            a project support unit to ensure proper and timely
            implementation of project procurement, disbursement,
            accounting and monitoring, and evaluation activities.
